page.title: 08Transport in Cowlinge
page.content: Cowlinge has no railway, the nearest town is eight miles away. From Monday to Friday, an early morning bus comes into the village and takes workers from here and neighbouring villages to their work in Haverhill. Every Wednesday a coach comes into the village taking shoppers into Bury-St-Edmunds. By walking 1.25 miles to the main road there is a very limited service of buses to Haverhill and Bury-St-Edmunds. It is,therefore,essential to have private transport for most residents to get to their place of work.
